title: Intervals
text: available intervals depends exchange use, source market data. , example, possible get monthly data binance. get overview available intervals, cryptoQuotes::availableIntervals-function can used. takes two arguments, source futures. Note: intervals necessarily equal across markets exchange available intervals directly passed character using theinterval argument, cryptoQuotes::getQuote-function.
code: cryptoQuotes::availableIntervals(   source = 'kucoin',   futures = TRUE ) #> ℹ Available Intervals at kucoin (futures) #> ✔ 1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 2h, 4h, 8h, 12h, 1d, 1w cryptoQuotes::availableIntervals(   source = 'kucoin',   futures = FALSE ) #> ℹ Available Intervals at kucoin (spot) #> ✔ 1m, 3m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 12h, 1d, 1w

title: Available Tickers
text: tradable tickers exchange supported. naming convention differs across exchanges, passing ATOMUSDT cryptoQuotes::getQuote argument necessarily provide ticker looking . get tradable assets desired market, exchange, can use cryptoQuotes::availableTickers() function. **Note: function evaluated fails R-CMD-CHECK github, CRAN. function returns character vector available tickers

title: Supported Exchanges
text: currently supported exchanges can viewed using cryptoQuotes::availableExchanges-function. arguments updated exchanges added package.
code: cryptoQuotes::availableExchanges() #> ℹ Available exchanges #> ✔ binance, kucoin, kraken

title: introduction
text: cryptoQuotes package provides access major cryptocurrency exchanges around world, uses xts zoo seamlessly works quantmod ttr.

title: introduction
text: Note: default, getQuote returns UTC index may trigger warning depending timezone. getQuote returns Open, High, Low, Close Volumes can visualized using chartSeries quantmod without programming.
code: ## load USDT denominated ATOM ## with hourly intervals ## for September spotAtom <- getQuote(   ticker   = 'ATOMUSDT',   source   = 'binance',   futures  = TRUE,   interval = '1h',    from     = '2023-09-01',   to       = '2023-09-08' ) ## chart the spotAtom ## with candlesticks quantmod::chartSeries(   x     = spotAtom,   theme = quantmod::chartTheme('white') )

title: introduction
text: tickers intervals various exchanges varies, dependent API. check get list available tickers, can use availableTickers ticker interst , example ,XBTUSDTM. might interesting look different intervals , , may differ exchange exchange. get overview available intervals use availableIntervals function. look 30m intervals, grab latest values possible. achieve , leave NULL futuresBTC can charted using quantmod , , chart can extended various indicators moving average convergence divergence (MACD).
code: ## list available ## tickers on kucoin futures ## market head(availableTickers(   source = 'kucoin',   futures = TRUE )) ## get available ## tickers on kucoin availableIntervals(   source = 'kucoin',   futures = TRUE ) ## extract XTBUSDTM ## from kucoin with ## 30m intervals futuresBTC <- getQuote(   ticker   = 'XBTUSDTM',   interval = '30m',   futures = TRUE,   source = 'kucoin'  ) ## chart the futuresBTC ## with candlesticks quantmod::chartSeries(   x     = futuresBTC,   theme = quantmod::chartTheme('white') ) ## chart the futuresBTC ## with candlesticks quantmod::addMACD()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Serkan Korkmaz. Maintainer, author, contributor, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Korkmaz S (2023). cryptoQuotes: Access Market Data Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges. R package version 1.0.0, https://serkor1.github.io/cryptoQuotes/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cryptoQuotes: Access Market Data from Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges},   author = {Serkan Korkmaz},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://serkor1.github.io/cryptoQuotes/}, }

title: Access Market Data from Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges
text: cryptoQuotes package unified REST API access public market data major cryptocurrency exchanges. package compatible quantmod TTR box.

title: Access Market Data from Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges
text: Currently, cryptoQuotes supports perpetual futures spot markets following exchanges; binance, kucoin kraken. exchanges added future. Note: cryptoQuotes supports various intervals limited different exchange APIs allows. lowest interval 1s (Seconds), highest 1M (Months)

title: Access Market Data from Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges
text: Get USDT denominated ATOM spot market Binance 30m intervals, spotPrice can passed chartSeries quantmod directly chart candlesticks.  spotPrice charted, indicators quantmod directly applicable. See example addBBands
code: ## get perpetual contracts on USDT denominated ATOM spotPrice <- cryptoQuotes::getQuote(   ticker = 'ATOMUSDT',   source = 'binance',   futures = FALSE,   interval = '30m' ) ## chart the spotPrice series ## using quantmod quantmod::chartSeries(   x = spotPrice,   theme = quantmod::chartTheme('black') ) ## add bollinger bands  ## using quantmod quantmod::addBBands()

title: Access Market Data from Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges
text: Stable Version Development Version
code: devtools::install_github(   repo = 'https://github.com/serkor1/cryptoQuotes/',   ref = 'main' ) devtools::install_github(   repo = 'https://github.com/serkor1/cryptoQuotes/',   ref = 'development' )

title: ATOM-USDT — ATOMUSDT
text: xts object primarily unit tests, serves purpose .

title: ATOM-USDT — ATOMUSDT
text: object class xts (inherits zoo) 27 rows 7 columns.

title: ATOM-USDT — ATOMUSDT
text: xts object daily OHLC USDT denominated ATOM 28 rows 7 columns, 2023-01-01 2023-01-07: Open Opening price High Highest price Low Lowest price Close Closing price market Determines wether Futures (0) Spot (1) markets. exchange Determines source data, ie. excange. Binance (1), Kucoin (2), Kraken (3)

title: availableExchanges — availableExchanges
text: function returns available exchanges

title: availableIntervals — availableIntervals
text: function shows available intervals available exchange

title: availableIntervals — availableIntervals
text: source character vector length one. Must name supported exchange futures logical. TRUE default. FALSE, spotmarket returned

title: availableTickers — availableTickers
text: function returns available pairs exchanges.

title: availableTickers — availableTickers
text: source character vector length 1. source API futures logical value. Default TRUE.

title: availableTickers — availableTickers
text: Returns character vector length N equal tradable tickers

what: cryptoQuotes: Access Market Data From Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges — cryptoQuotes-package
title: cryptoQuotes: Access Market Data From Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges — cryptoQuotes-package
text: Access spot futures markets major cryptocurrency exchanges.

title: cryptoQuotes: Access Market Data From Major Cryptocurrency Exchanges — cryptoQuotes-package
text: Maintainer: Serkan Korkmaz serkor1@duck.com [contributor]

title: getQuote — getQuote
text: function returns crypto quote

title: getQuote — getQuote
code: getQuote(   ticker,   source = "binance",   futures = TRUE,   interval,   from = NULL,   to = NULL )

title: getQuote — getQuote
text: ticker character vector length 1. Uppercase. source character vector length 1. Currently binance supported. futures logical value. TRUE default. FALSE, function return spot prices. interval character vector length 1. See availableIntervals() full list. character vector length 1. Given %Y-%m-%d format. character vector length 1.Given %Y-%m-%d format.

title: getQuote — getQuote
code: # script: scr_getQuote # date: 2023-09-22 # author: Serkan Korkmaz, serkor1@duck.com # objective: demonstrate how to use # the getQuote # script start;  # gc rm(list = ls()); invisible(gc())  # 1) load perpetual # futures # # NOTE: The function is wrapped # in try to avoid failing # the R-CMD-CHECK on Github perpAtom <- try(   cryptoQuotes::getQuote(   ticker  = 'ATOMUSDT',   source = 'binance',   interval = '15m',   futures = TRUE ) ) #> Error in response[, 1] : incorrect number of dimensions   # 2) head data; if (!inherits(perpAtom, 'try-error')) {    head(perpAtom)  }   # script end;
